intro: Jambosa coarctata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf jambosa, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant produces edible fruits that are typically pear-shaped and covered in a fuzzy coating. It is native to tropical regions of South America and thrives in warm, humid climates. Due to its ornamental value and fruit-bearing potential, it is cultivated in some horticultural settings.
